intro: Ruellia vincoides, commonly known as the Mexican bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Ruellia vincoides is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
